p: Hoechst 33342 dye is used to detect the morphological changes of apoptotic cells. Briefly, HeLa cells (2 × 10 5) were seeded in a 12-well plate and were cultured overnight. The cells subsequently were incubated with a designed concentration of ONP for 24 h. Hoechst 33342 dye (5 µg·mL −1) was added and continued culturing for 30 minutes. Rinsed HeLa cells with the medium to remove the remaining Hoechst 33342. The stained nuclei were photographed under a fluorescent microscope.
